House File 2198 - Introduced


                                 HOUSE FILE 

                                 HOUSE FILE 
                                 HOUSE FILE                                  HOUSE FILE                                  BY  WILLS

 A BILL FOR

  1 An Act relating to persistently lowest=achieving schools
  2    by authorizing parents or guardians to petition for the
  3    closure of an attendance center, for implementation of an
  4    education voucher program, or for establishment of a charter
  5    school, establishing an education voucher fund, making
  6    appropriations, and providing penalties.
  7 BE IT ENACTED BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF THE STATE OF IOWA:
    TLSB 5164YH (4) 86
    md/sc

PAG LIN

  1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3

  1 16    1.  If an attendance center is identified by the department
  1 17 of education as a persistently lowest=achieving school within
  1 18 the meaning of section 256.9, subsection 61, the parents or
  1 19 guardians of students enrolled at the attendance center may
  1 20 submit a petition to the school board to either close the
  1 21 attendance center pursuant to section 256E.3 or authorize
  1 22 education vouchers for students of the attendance center under
  1 23 section 256E.4.
  1 24    2.  A valid petition under this section must state whether
  1 25 the petition is requesting the closure of an attendance center
  1 26 pursuant to section 256E.3 or the authorization of education
  1 27 vouchers under section 256E.4, and must contain the signatures
  1 28 of at least fifty percent of the parents or guardians whose
  1 29 children are enrolled at the attendance center. A valid
  1 30 petition under this section must be received by the school
  1 31 board not later than December 1 of the school year preceding
  1 32 the school year during which the requested action will be
  1 33 implemented.  A petition received after that deadline will be
  1 34 considered a petition for the next applicable school year.

  2  1 agency, the state board shall, after consulting with the

  2  4    Sec. 4.    2  4    Sec. 4.    2  5 reallocation of students.
  2  6    1.  If a valid petition for closure of an attendance center
  2  7 is received by a school board under section 256E.2, the school
  2  8 board shall formulate and implement a plan for the closure
  2  9 of the attendance center and a plan for the reallocation of
  2 10 students currently enrolled at the attendance center and those
  2 11 students who would, but for the closure, be enrolled at the
  2 12 attendance center during the next school year.
  2 13    2.  The plan for the reallocation of students to other
  2 14 attendance centers in the school district shall include
  2 15 objective criteria and standards and criteria for prioritizing
  2 16 requests that do not have an adverse impact on the plan.
  2 17    3.  a.  If other attendance centers in the school district
  2 18 have insufficient classroom space to accommodate the students
  2 19 from the closing attendance center, the school board shall
  2 20 instead implement the education voucher program under section
  2 21 256E.4.
  2 22    b.  Every school district shall adopt a policy that defines
  2 23 the term "insufficient classroom space" for each attendance
  2 24 center in that district.
  2 25    Sec. 5.    2  6    1.  If a valid petition for closure of an attendance center
  2  7 is received by a school board under section 256E.2, the school
  2  8 board shall formulate and implement a plan for the closure
  2  9 of the attendance center and a plan for the reallocation of
  2 10 students currently enrolled at the attendance center and those
  2 11 students who would, but for the closure, be enrolled at the
  2 12 attendance center during the next school year.
  2 13    2.  The plan for the reallocation of students to other
  2 14 attendance centers in the school district shall include
  2 15 objective criteria and standards and criteria for prioritizing
  2 16 requests that do not have an adverse impact on the plan.
  2 17    3.  a.  If other attendance centers in the school district
  2 18 have insufficient classroom space to accommodate the students
  2 19 from the closing attendance center, the school board shall
  2 20 instead implement the education voucher program under section
  2 21 256E.4.
  2 22    b.  Every school district shall adopt a policy that defines
  2 23 the term "insufficient classroom space" for each attendance
  2 24 center in that district.
  2 25    Sec. 5.    2  7 is received by a school board under section 256E.2, the school
  2  8 board shall formulate and implement a plan for the closure
  2  9 of the attendance center and a plan for the reallocation of

  2 25    Sec. 5.    2 25    Sec. 5.    2 26    1.  a.  If a valid petition authorizing education vouchers
  2 27 is received by a school board under section 256E.2, or if
  2 28 section 256E.3, subsection 3, is applicable, students eligible
  2 29 to enroll in kindergarten through grade twelve and who are
  2 30 enrolled at the attendance center at the time the applicable
  2 31 petition is filed are eligible to receive education vouchers.
  2 32    b.  Education vouchers shall be made available to parents
  2 33 and guardians in the manner authorized under subsection
  2 34 4, paragraph "c", for the payment of qualified educational
  2 35 expenses as provided in this section.
  3  1    2.  a.  (1)  By January 31 preceding the school year for
  3  2 which the education voucher is requested, the parent or
  3  3 guardian of the student requesting to receive an education
  3  4 voucher shall submit an application to the department of
  3  5 education, on application forms developed by the department,
  3  6 indicating that the parent or guardian intends to enroll the
  3  7 student in a nonpublic school.
  3  8    (2)  In addition to other information deemed appropriate
  3  9 by the department of education, the application shall require
  3 10 certification from the nonpublic school of the student's
  3 11 enrollment for the following school year.
  3 12    b.  By March 1 preceding the school year for which the
  3 13 education voucher is requested, the department of education
  3 14 shall notify the department of management of the number of
  3 15 students in each school district designated for the following
  3 16 school year to receive an education voucher. The department
  3 17 of education shall also notify the parent or guardian of such
  3 18 students who are approved to receive an education voucher.
  3 19    c.  Education vouchers shall only be approved for one school
  3 20 year per application, and applications must be submitted under
  3 21 paragraph "a" for education vouchers in subsequent school
  3 22 years.
  3 23    3.  The department of management shall assign each student an
  3 24 education voucher in an amount equal to seventy=five percent of
  3 25 the district of residence's regular program district cost per
  3 26 pupil in the same school year.
  3 27    4.  An education voucher fund is created in the state
  3 28 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 29 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department for
  3 30 the purpose of providing education vouchers under this
  3 31 section. For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2017, and
  3 32 each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the
  3 33 general fund of the state to the department of management to be
  3 34 credited to the fund the amount necessary to pay all education
  3 35 vouchers approved for that fiscal year. The director of the
  4  1 department of management has all powers necessary to carry out
  4  2 and effectuate the purposes, objectives, and provisions of this
  4  3 section pertaining to the fund, including the power to do all
  4  4 of the following:
  4  5    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  4  6 administration of the fund.
  4  7    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  4  8 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  4  9    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  4 10 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4 11 including providing for the disbursement of education vouchers
  4 12 in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that are
  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.
  4 16    e.  Adopt rules pursuant to chapter 17A for the
  4 17 administration of the fund and accounts in the fund.
  4 18    5.  a.  For each student approved for an education voucher,
  4 19 the department shall establish an account for that student
  4 20 in the education voucher fund. The student's education
  4 21 voucher shall be deposited into the student's account on July
  4 22 1 and funds shall be immediately available for the payment
  4 23 of qualified educational expenses incurred by the parent or
  4 24 guardian for the student during that fiscal year using the
  4 25 payment method authorized under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 26    b.  A nonpublic school or other entity that accepts payment
  4 27 from a parent or guardian using funds from a student's account
  4 28 in the education voucher fund shall not refund, rebate, or
  4 29 share any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian,
  4 30 or student.
  4 31    c.  Moneys remaining in a student's account upon conclusion
  4 32 of the fiscal year shall remain in the student's account in the
  4 33 education voucher fund for the payment of qualified educational
  4 34 expenses in future fiscal years, unless subject to the transfer
  4 35 required under subsection 8.
  5  1    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  5  2 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  5  3 textbooks, fees, or payments for educational therapies
  5  4 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  5  5 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific
  5  6 subject matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic
  5  7 online education programs, education materials and services
  5  8 for students with disabilities including the cost of
  5  9 paraprofessionals and assistants who are trained in accordance
  5 10 with state law, and other expenses incurred by the parent or
  5 11 guardian that are directly related to the education of the
  5 12 student at a nonpublic school, including a nonpublic school
  5 13 accredited by an independent accrediting agency approved by
  5 14 the department of education. "Qualified educational expenses"
  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost
  5 16 of food or refreshments consumed by the student, the cost of
  5 17 clothing for the student, or the cost of disposable materials,
  5 18 including but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens,
  5 19 and art supplies.
  5 20    b.  For purposes of this section, "nonpublic school" means
  5 21 the same as defined in section 285.16.
  5 22    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose of
  5 23 obtaining an education voucher provided for in this section or
  5 24 who knowingly receives the voucher or makes a payment from an
  5 25 account in the education voucher fund without being legally
  5 26 entitled to it is guilty of a fraudulent practice. The false
  5 27 claim for an education voucher or a payment from an account
  5 28 shall be disallowed and if amounts from the voucher have
  5 29 been disbursed from the applicable account in the education
  5 30 voucher fund, the department of management shall initiate legal
  5 31 proceedings to recover such amounts. A parent or guardian who
  5 32 violates this subsection is prohibited from participating in
  5 33 the education voucher program in the future.
  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.
  6  9    Sec. 6.  Section 256F.3, subsection 2, paragraph a, Code

  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost
  5 16 of food or refreshments consumed by the student, the cost of
  5 17 clothing for the student, or the cost of disposable materials,
  5 18 including but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens,
  5 19 and art supplies.
  5 20    b.  For purposes of this section, "nonpublic school" means
  5 21 the same as defined in section 285.16.
  5 22    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose of
  5 23 obtaining an education voucher provided for in this section or
  5 24 who knowingly receives the voucher or makes a payment from an
  5 25 account in the education voucher fund without being legally
  5 26 entitled to it is guilty of a fraudulent practice. The false
  5 27 claim for an education voucher or a payment from an account
  5 28 shall be disallowed and if amounts from the voucher have
  5 29 been disbursed from the applicable account in the education
  5 30 voucher fund, the department of management shall initiate legal
  5 31 proceedings to recover such amounts. A parent or guardian who
  5 32 violates this subsection is prohibited from participating in
  5 33 the education voucher program in the future.
  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.
  6  9    Sec. 6.  Section 256F.3, subsection 2, paragraph a, Code
  6 10 2016, is amended to read as follows:
  6 11    a.    2 29 to enroll in kindergarten through grade twelve and who are
  2 30 enrolled at the attendance center at the time the applicable
  2 31 petition is filed are eligible to receive education vouchers.
  2 32    b.  Education vouchers shall be made available to parents
  2 33 and guardians in the manner authorized under subsection
  2 34 4, paragraph "c", for the payment of qualified educational
  2 35 expenses as provided in this section.
  3  1    2.  a.  (1)  By January 31 preceding the school year for
  3  2 which the education voucher is requested, the parent or
  3  3 guardian of the student requesting to receive an education
  3  4 voucher shall submit an application to the department of
  3  5 education, on application forms developed by the department,
  3  6 indicating that the parent or guardian intends to enroll the
  3  7 student in a nonpublic school.
  3  8    (2)  In addition to other information deemed appropriate
  3  9 by the department of education, the application shall require
  3 10 certification from the nonpublic school of the student's
  3 11 enrollment for the following school year.
  3 12    b.  By March 1 preceding the school year for which the
  3 13 education voucher is requested, the department of education
  3 14 shall notify the department of management of the number of
  3 15 students in each school district designated for the following
  3 16 school year to receive an education voucher. The department
  3 17 of education shall also notify the parent or guardian of such
  3 18 students who are approved to receive an education voucher.
  3 19    c.  Education vouchers shall only be approved for one school
  3 20 year per application, and applications must be submitted under
  3 21 paragraph "a" for education vouchers in subsequent school
  3 22 years.
  3 23    3.  The department of management shall assign each student an
  3 24 education voucher in an amount equal to seventy=five percent of
  3 25 the district of residence's regular program district cost per
  3 26 pupil in the same school year.
  3 27    4.  An education voucher fund is created in the state
  3 28 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 29 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department for
  3 30 the purpose of providing education vouchers under this
  3 31 section. For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2017, and
  3 32 each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the
  3 33 general fund of the state to the department of management to be
  3 34 credited to the fund the amount necessary to pay all education
  3 35 vouchers approved for that fiscal year. The director of the
  4  1 department of management has all powers necessary to carry out
  4  2 and effectuate the purposes, objectives, and provisions of this
  4  3 section pertaining to the fund, including the power to do all
  4  4 of the following:
  4  5    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  4  6 administration of the fund.
  4  7    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  4  8 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  4  9    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  4 10 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4 11 including providing for the disbursement of education vouchers
  4 12 in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that are
  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.
  4 16    e.  Adopt rules pursuant to chapter 17A for the
  4 17 administration of the fund and accounts in the fund.
  4 18    5.  a.  For each student approved for an education voucher,
  4 19 the department shall establish an account for that student
  4 20 in the education voucher fund. The student's education
  4 21 voucher shall be deposited into the student's account on July
  4 22 1 and funds shall be immediately available for the payment
  4 23 of qualified educational expenses incurred by the parent or
  4 24 guardian for the student during that fiscal year using the
  4 25 payment method authorized under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 26    b.  A nonpublic school or other entity that accepts payment
  4 27 from a parent or guardian using funds from a student's account
  4 28 in the education voucher fund shall not refund, rebate, or
  4 29 share any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian,
  4 30 or student.
  4 31    c.  Moneys remaining in a student's account upon conclusion
  4 32 of the fiscal year shall remain in the student's account in the
  4 33 education voucher fund for the payment of qualified educational
  4 34 expenses in future fiscal years, unless subject to the transfer
  4 35 required under subsection 8.
  5  1    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  5  2 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  5  3 textbooks, fees, or payments for educational therapies
  5  4 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  5  5 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific
  5  6 subject matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic
  5  7 online education programs, education materials and services
  5  8 for students with disabilities including the cost of
  5  9 paraprofessionals and assistants who are trained in accordance

  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.
  6  9    Sec. 6.  Section 256F.3, subsection 2, paragraph a, Code
  6 10 2016, is amended to read as follows:
  6 11    a.    2 33 and guardians in the manner authorized under subsection
  2 34 4, paragraph "c", for the payment of qualified educational
  2 35 expenses as provided in this section.
  3  1    2.  a.  (1)  By January 31 preceding the school year for
  3  2 which the education voucher is requested, the parent or
  3  3 guardian of the student requesting to receive an education
  3  4 voucher shall submit an application to the department of
  3  5 education, on application forms developed by the department,
  3  6 indicating that the parent or guardian intends to enroll the
  3  7 student in a nonpublic school.
  3  8    (2)  In addition to other information deemed appropriate
  3  9 by the department of education, the application shall require
  3 10 certification from the nonpublic school of the student's
  3 11 enrollment for the following school year.
  3 12    b.  By March 1 preceding the school year for which the
  3 13 education voucher is requested, the department of education
  3 14 shall notify the department of management of the number of
  3 15 students in each school district designated for the following
  3 16 school year to receive an education voucher. The department
  3 17 of education shall also notify the parent or guardian of such
  3 18 students who are approved to receive an education voucher.
  3 19    c.  Education vouchers shall only be approved for one school
  3 20 year per application, and applications must be submitted under
  3 21 paragraph "a" for education vouchers in subsequent school
  3 22 years.
  3 23    3.  The department of management shall assign each student an
  3 24 education voucher in an amount equal to seventy=five percent of
  3 25 the district of residence's regular program district cost per
  3 26 pupil in the same school year.
  3 27    4.  An education voucher fund is created in the state
  3 28 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 29 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department for
  3 30 the purpose of providing education vouchers under this
  3 31 section. For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2017, and
  3 32 each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the
  3 33 general fund of the state to the department of management to be
  3 34 credited to the fund the amount necessary to pay all education
  3 35 vouchers approved for that fiscal year. The director of the
  4  1 department of management has all powers necessary to carry out
  4  2 and effectuate the purposes, objectives, and provisions of this
  4  3 section pertaining to the fund, including the power to do all
  4  4 of the following:
  4  5    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  4  6 administration of the fund.
  4  7    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  4  8 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  4  9    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  4 10 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4 11 including providing for the disbursement of education vouchers
  4 12 in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that are
  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.
  4 16    e.  Adopt rules pursuant to chapter 17A for the
  4 17 administration of the fund and accounts in the fund.
  4 18    5.  a.  For each student approved for an education voucher,
  4 19 the department shall establish an account for that student
  4 20 in the education voucher fund. The student's education
  4 21 voucher shall be deposited into the student's account on July
  4 22 1 and funds shall be immediately available for the payment
  4 23 of qualified educational expenses incurred by the parent or
  4 24 guardian for the student during that fiscal year using the
  4 25 payment method authorized under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 26    b.  A nonpublic school or other entity that accepts payment
  4 27 from a parent or guardian using funds from a student's account
  4 28 in the education voucher fund shall not refund, rebate, or
  4 29 share any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian,
  4 30 or student.
  4 31    c.  Moneys remaining in a student's account upon conclusion
  4 32 of the fiscal year shall remain in the student's account in the
  4 33 education voucher fund for the payment of qualified educational
  4 34 expenses in future fiscal years, unless subject to the transfer
  4 35 required under subsection 8.
  5  1    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  5  2 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  5  3 textbooks, fees, or payments for educational therapies
  5  4 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  5  5 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific
  5  6 subject matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic
  5  7 online education programs, education materials and services
  5  8 for students with disabilities including the cost of
  5  9 paraprofessionals and assistants who are trained in accordance
  5 10 with state law, and other expenses incurred by the parent or
  5 11 guardian that are directly related to the education of the
  5 12 student at a nonpublic school, including a nonpublic school
  5 13 accredited by an independent accrediting agency approved by
  5 14 the department of education. "Qualified educational expenses"
  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost
  5 16 of food or refreshments consumed by the student, the cost of
  5 17 clothing for the student, or the cost of disposable materials,
  5 18 including but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens,
  5 19 and art supplies.
  5 20    b.  For purposes of this section, "nonpublic school" means
  5 21 the same as defined in section 285.16.
  5 22    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose of
  5 23 obtaining an education voucher provided for in this section or
  5 24 who knowingly receives the voucher or makes a payment from an
  5 25 account in the education voucher fund without being legally
  5 26 entitled to it is guilty of a fraudulent practice. The false
  5 27 claim for an education voucher or a payment from an account
  5 28 shall be disallowed and if amounts from the voucher have
  5 29 been disbursed from the applicable account in the education
  5 30 voucher fund, the department of management shall initiate legal
  5 31 proceedings to recover such amounts. A parent or guardian who
  5 32 violates this subsection is prohibited from participating in
  5 33 the education voucher program in the future.
  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.

  3 25 the district of residence's regular program district cost per
  3 26 pupil in the same school year.
  3 27    4.  An education voucher fund is created in the state
  3 28 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 29 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department for
  3 30 the purpose of providing education vouchers under this
  3 31 section. For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2017, and
  3 32 each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the
  3 33 general fund of the state to the department of management to be
  3 34 credited to the fund the amount necessary to pay all education
  3 35 vouchers approved for that fiscal year. The director of the
  4  1 department of management has all powers necessary to carry out
  4  2 and effectuate the purposes, objectives, and provisions of this
  4  3 section pertaining to the fund, including the power to do all
  4  4 of the following:
  4  5    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  4  6 administration of the fund.
  4  7    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  4  8 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  4  9    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  4 10 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4 11 including providing for the disbursement of education vouchers
  4 12 in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that are
  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.
  4 16    e.  Adopt rules pursuant to chapter 17A for the
  4 17 administration of the fund and accounts in the fund.
  4 18    5.  a.  For each student approved for an education voucher,
  4 19 the department shall establish an account for that student
  4 20 in the education voucher fund. The student's education
  4 21 voucher shall be deposited into the student's account on July
  4 22 1 and funds shall be immediately available for the payment
  4 23 of qualified educational expenses incurred by the parent or
  4 24 guardian for the student during that fiscal year using the
  4 25 payment method authorized under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 26    b.  A nonpublic school or other entity that accepts payment
  4 27 from a parent or guardian using funds from a student's account
  4 28 in the education voucher fund shall not refund, rebate, or
  4 29 share any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian,
  4 30 or student.
  4 31    c.  Moneys remaining in a student's account upon conclusion
  4 32 of the fiscal year shall remain in the student's account in the
  4 33 education voucher fund for the payment of qualified educational
  4 34 expenses in future fiscal years, unless subject to the transfer
  4 35 required under subsection 8.
  5  1    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  5  2 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  5  3 textbooks, fees, or payments for educational therapies
  5  4 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  5  5 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific
  5  6 subject matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic
  5  7 online education programs, education materials and services
  5  8 for students with disabilities including the cost of
  5  9 paraprofessionals and assistants who are trained in accordance
  5 10 with state law, and other expenses incurred by the parent or
  5 11 guardian that are directly related to the education of the
  5 12 student at a nonpublic school, including a nonpublic school
  5 13 accredited by an independent accrediting agency approved by
  5 14 the department of education. "Qualified educational expenses"
  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost
  5 16 of food or refreshments consumed by the student, the cost of
  5 17 clothing for the student, or the cost of disposable materials,
  5 18 including but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens,
  5 19 and art supplies.
  5 20    b.  For purposes of this section, "nonpublic school" means
  5 21 the same as defined in section 285.16.
  5 22    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose of
  5 23 obtaining an education voucher provided for in this section or
  5 24 who knowingly receives the voucher or makes a payment from an
  5 25 account in the education voucher fund without being legally
  5 26 entitled to it is guilty of a fraudulent practice. The false
  5 27 claim for an education voucher or a payment from an account
  5 28 shall be disallowed and if amounts from the voucher have
  5 29 been disbursed from the applicable account in the education
  5 30 voucher fund, the department of management shall initiate legal
  5 31 proceedings to recover such amounts. A parent or guardian who
  5 32 violates this subsection is prohibited from participating in
  5 33 the education voucher program in the future.
  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.
  6  9    Sec. 6.  Section 256F.3, subsection 2, paragraph a, Code
  6 10 2016, is amended to read as follows:
  6 11    a.    3  3 guardian of the student requesting to receive an education
  3  4 voucher shall submit an application to the department of
  3  5 education, on application forms developed by the department,
  3  6 indicating that the parent or guardian intends to enroll the
  3  7 student in a nonpublic school.
  3  8    (2)  In addition to other information deemed appropriate
  3  9 by the department of education, the application shall require
  3 10 certification from the nonpublic school of the student's
  3 11 enrollment for the following school year.
  3 12    b.  By March 1 preceding the school year for which the
  3 13 education voucher is requested, the department of education
  3 14 shall notify the department of management of the number of
  3 15 students in each school district designated for the following
  3 16 school year to receive an education voucher. The department
  3 17 of education shall also notify the parent or guardian of such
  3 18 students who are approved to receive an education voucher.
  3 19    c.  Education vouchers shall only be approved for one school
  3 20 year per application, and applications must be submitted under
  3 21 paragraph "a" for education vouchers in subsequent school
  3 22 years.
  3 23    3.  The department of management shall assign each student an
  3 24 education voucher in an amount equal to seventy=five percent of
  3 25 the district of residence's regular program district cost per

  5 10 with state law, and other expenses incurred by the parent or
  5 11 guardian that are directly related to the education of the
  5 12 student at a nonpublic school, including a nonpublic school
  5 13 accredited by an independent accrediting agency approved by
  5 14 the department of education. "Qualified educational expenses"
  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost
  5 16 of food or refreshments consumed by the student, the cost of
  5 17 clothing for the student, or the cost of disposable materials,
  5 18 including but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens,
  5 19 and art supplies.
  5 20    b.  For purposes of this section, "nonpublic school" means
  5 21 the same as defined in section 285.16.
  5 22    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose of
  5 23 obtaining an education voucher provided for in this section or
  5 24 who knowingly receives the voucher or makes a payment from an
  5 25 account in the education voucher fund without being legally
  5 26 entitled to it is guilty of a fraudulent practice. The false
  5 27 claim for an education voucher or a payment from an account
  5 28 shall be disallowed and if amounts from the voucher have
  5 29 been disbursed from the applicable account in the education
  5 30 voucher fund, the department of management shall initiate legal
  5 31 proceedings to recover such amounts. A parent or guardian who
  5 32 violates this subsection is prohibited from participating in
  5 33 the education voucher program in the future.
  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.
  6  9    Sec. 6.  Section 256F.3, subsection 2, paragraph a, Code
  6 10 2016, is amended to read as follows:
  6 11    a.    3  7 student in a nonpublic school.
  3  8    (2)  In addition to other information deemed appropriate
  3  9 by the department of education, the application shall require
  3 10 certification from the nonpublic school of the student's
  3 11 enrollment for the following school year.
  3 12    b.  By March 1 preceding the school year for which the
  3 13 education voucher is requested, the department of education
  3 14 shall notify the department of management of the number of
  3 15 students in each school district designated for the following
  3 16 school year to receive an education voucher. The department
  3 17 of education shall also notify the parent or guardian of such
  3 18 students who are approved to receive an education voucher.
  3 19    c.  Education vouchers shall only be approved for one school
  3 20 year per application, and applications must be submitted under
  3 21 paragraph "a" for education vouchers in subsequent school
  3 22 years.
  3 23    3.  The department of management shall assign each student an
  3 24 education voucher in an amount equal to seventy=five percent of
  3 25 the district of residence's regular program district cost per
  3 26 pupil in the same school year.
  3 27    4.  An education voucher fund is created in the state
  3 28 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 29 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department for
  3 30 the purpose of providing education vouchers under this
  3 31 section. For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2017, and
  3 32 each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the
  3 33 general fund of the state to the department of management to be
  3 34 credited to the fund the amount necessary to pay all education
  3 35 vouchers approved for that fiscal year. The director of the
  4  1 department of management has all powers necessary to carry out
  4  2 and effectuate the purposes, objectives, and provisions of this
  4  3 section pertaining to the fund, including the power to do all
  4  4 of the following:
  4  5    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  4  6 administration of the fund.
  4  7    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  4  8 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  4  9    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  4 10 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4 11 including providing for the disbursement of education vouchers
  4 12 in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that are
  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.
  4 16    e.  Adopt rules pursuant to chapter 17A for the
  4 17 administration of the fund and accounts in the fund.
  4 18    5.  a.  For each student approved for an education voucher,
  4 19 the department shall establish an account for that student
  4 20 in the education voucher fund. The student's education
  4 21 voucher shall be deposited into the student's account on July
  4 22 1 and funds shall be immediately available for the payment
  4 23 of qualified educational expenses incurred by the parent or
  4 24 guardian for the student during that fiscal year using the
  4 25 payment method authorized under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 26    b.  A nonpublic school or other entity that accepts payment
  4 27 from a parent or guardian using funds from a student's account
  4 28 in the education voucher fund shall not refund, rebate, or
  4 29 share any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian,
  4 30 or student.
  4 31    c.  Moneys remaining in a student's account upon conclusion
  4 32 of the fiscal year shall remain in the student's account in the
  4 33 education voucher fund for the payment of qualified educational
  4 34 expenses in future fiscal years, unless subject to the transfer
  4 35 required under subsection 8.
  5  1    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  5  2 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  5  3 textbooks, fees, or payments for educational therapies
  5  4 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  5  5 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific

  4 11 including providing for the disbursement of education vouchers
  4 12 in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that are
  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.
  4 16    e.  Adopt rules pursuant to chapter 17A for the
  4 17 administration of the fund and accounts in the fund.
  4 18    5.  a.  For each student approved for an education voucher,
  4 19 the department shall establish an account for that student
  4 20 in the education voucher fund. The student's education
  4 21 voucher shall be deposited into the student's account on July
  4 22 1 and funds shall be immediately available for the payment
  4 23 of qualified educational expenses incurred by the parent or
  4 24 guardian for the student during that fiscal year using the
  4 25 payment method authorized under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 26    b.  A nonpublic school or other entity that accepts payment
  4 27 from a parent or guardian using funds from a student's account
  4 28 in the education voucher fund shall not refund, rebate, or
  4 29 share any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian,
  4 30 or student.
  4 31    c.  Moneys remaining in a student's account upon conclusion
  4 32 of the fiscal year shall remain in the student's account in the
  4 33 education voucher fund for the payment of qualified educational
  4 34 expenses in future fiscal years, unless subject to the transfer
  4 35 required under subsection 8.
  5  1    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  5  2 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  5  3 textbooks, fees, or payments for educational therapies
  5  4 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  5  5 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific
  5  6 subject matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic
  5  7 online education programs, education materials and services
  5  8 for students with disabilities including the cost of
  5  9 paraprofessionals and assistants who are trained in accordance
  5 10 with state law, and other expenses incurred by the parent or
  5 11 guardian that are directly related to the education of the
  5 12 student at a nonpublic school, including a nonpublic school
  5 13 accredited by an independent accrediting agency approved by
  5 14 the department of education. "Qualified educational expenses"
  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost
  5 16 of food or refreshments consumed by the student, the cost of
  5 17 clothing for the student, or the cost of disposable materials,
  5 18 including but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens,
  5 19 and art supplies.
  5 20    b.  For purposes of this section, "nonpublic school" means
  5 21 the same as defined in section 285.16.
  5 22    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose of
  5 23 obtaining an education voucher provided for in this section or
  5 24 who knowingly receives the voucher or makes a payment from an
  5 25 account in the education voucher fund without being legally
  5 26 entitled to it is guilty of a fraudulent practice. The false
  5 27 claim for an education voucher or a payment from an account
  5 28 shall be disallowed and if amounts from the voucher have
  5 29 been disbursed from the applicable account in the education
  5 30 voucher fund, the department of management shall initiate legal
  5 31 proceedings to recover such amounts. A parent or guardian who
  5 32 violates this subsection is prohibited from participating in
  5 33 the education voucher program in the future.
  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.
  6  9    Sec. 6.  Section 256F.3, subsection 2, paragraph a, Code
  6 10 2016, is amended to read as follows:
  6 11    a.    3 12    b.  By March 1 preceding the school year for which the
  3 13 education voucher is requested, the department of education
  3 14 shall notify the department of management of the number of
  3 15 students in each school district designated for the following
  3 16 school year to receive an education voucher. The department
  3 17 of education shall also notify the parent or guardian of such
  3 18 students who are approved to receive an education voucher.
  3 19    c.  Education vouchers shall only be approved for one school
  3 20 year per application, and applications must be submitted under
  3 21 paragraph "a" for education vouchers in subsequent school
  3 22 years.
  3 23    3.  The department of management shall assign each student an
  3 24 education voucher in an amount equal to seventy=five percent of
  3 25 the district of residence's regular program district cost per
  3 26 pupil in the same school year.
  3 27    4.  An education voucher fund is created in the state
  3 28 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 29 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department for
  3 30 the purpose of providing education vouchers under this
  3 31 section. For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2017, and
  3 32 each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the
  3 33 general fund of the state to the department of management to be
  3 34 credited to the fund the amount necessary to pay all education
  3 35 vouchers approved for that fiscal year. The director of the
  4  1 department of management has all powers necessary to carry out
  4  2 and effectuate the purposes, objectives, and provisions of this
  4  3 section pertaining to the fund, including the power to do all
  4  4 of the following:
  4  5    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  4  6 administration of the fund.
  4  7    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  4  8 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  4  9    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to

  3 35 vouchers approved for that fiscal year. The director of the
  4  1 department of management has all powers necessary to carry out
  4  2 and effectuate the purposes, objectives, and provisions of this
  4  3 section pertaining to the fund, including the power to do all
  4  4 of the following:
  4  5    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  4  6 administration of the fund.
  4  7    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  4  8 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  4  9    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  4 10 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4 11 including providing for the disbursement of education vouchers
  4 12 in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that are
  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.
  4 16    e.  Adopt rules pursuant to chapter 17A for the
  4 17 administration of the fund and accounts in the fund.
  4 18    5.  a.  For each student approved for an education voucher,
  4 19 the department shall establish an account for that student
  4 20 in the education voucher fund. The student's education
  4 21 voucher shall be deposited into the student's account on July
  4 22 1 and funds shall be immediately available for the payment
  4 23 of qualified educational expenses incurred by the parent or
  4 24 guardian for the student during that fiscal year using the
  4 25 payment method authorized under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 26    b.  A nonpublic school or other entity that accepts payment
  4 27 from a parent or guardian using funds from a student's account
  4 28 in the education voucher fund shall not refund, rebate, or
  4 29 share any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian,
  4 30 or student.
  4 31    c.  Moneys remaining in a student's account upon conclusion
  4 32 of the fiscal year shall remain in the student's account in the
  4 33 education voucher fund for the payment of qualified educational
  4 34 expenses in future fiscal years, unless subject to the transfer
  4 35 required under subsection 8.
  5  1    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  5  2 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  5  3 textbooks, fees, or payments for educational therapies
  5  4 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  5  5 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific
  5  6 subject matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic
  5  7 online education programs, education materials and services
  5  8 for students with disabilities including the cost of
  5  9 paraprofessionals and assistants who are trained in accordance
  5 10 with state law, and other expenses incurred by the parent or
  5 11 guardian that are directly related to the education of the
  5 12 student at a nonpublic school, including a nonpublic school
  5 13 accredited by an independent accrediting agency approved by
  5 14 the department of education. "Qualified educational expenses"
  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost
  5 16 of food or refreshments consumed by the student, the cost of
  5 17 clothing for the student, or the cost of disposable materials,
  5 18 including but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens,
  5 19 and art supplies.
  5 20    b.  For purposes of this section, "nonpublic school" means
  5 21 the same as defined in section 285.16.
  5 22    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose of
  5 23 obtaining an education voucher provided for in this section or
  5 24 who knowingly receives the voucher or makes a payment from an
  5 25 account in the education voucher fund without being legally
  5 26 entitled to it is guilty of a fraudulent practice. The false
  5 27 claim for an education voucher or a payment from an account
  5 28 shall be disallowed and if amounts from the voucher have
  5 29 been disbursed from the applicable account in the education
  5 30 voucher fund, the department of management shall initiate legal
  5 31 proceedings to recover such amounts. A parent or guardian who
  5 32 violates this subsection is prohibited from participating in
  5 33 the education voucher program in the future.
  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.
  6  9    Sec. 6.  Section 256F.3, subsection 2, paragraph a, Code

  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.
  4 16    e.  Adopt rules pursuant to chapter 17A for the
  4 17 administration of the fund and accounts in the fund.
  4 18    5.  a.  For each student approved for an education voucher,
  4 19 the department shall establish an account for that student
  4 20 in the education voucher fund. The student's education
  4 21 voucher shall be deposited into the student's account on July
  4 22 1 and funds shall be immediately available for the payment
  4 23 of qualified educational expenses incurred by the parent or
  4 24 guardian for the student during that fiscal year using the
  4 25 payment method authorized under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 26    b.  A nonpublic school or other entity that accepts payment
  4 27 from a parent or guardian using funds from a student's account
  4 28 in the education voucher fund shall not refund, rebate, or
  4 29 share any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian,
  4 30 or student.
  4 31    c.  Moneys remaining in a student's account upon conclusion
  4 32 of the fiscal year shall remain in the student's account in the
  4 33 education voucher fund for the payment of qualified educational
  4 34 expenses in future fiscal years, unless subject to the transfer
  4 35 required under subsection 8.
  5  1    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  5  2 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  5  3 textbooks, fees, or payments for educational therapies
  5  4 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  5  5 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific
  5  6 subject matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic
  5  7 online education programs, education materials and services
  5  8 for students with disabilities including the cost of
  5  9 paraprofessionals and assistants who are trained in accordance
  5 10 with state law, and other expenses incurred by the parent or
  5 11 guardian that are directly related to the education of the
  5 12 student at a nonpublic school, including a nonpublic school
  5 13 accredited by an independent accrediting agency approved by
  5 14 the department of education. "Qualified educational expenses"
  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost
  5 16 of food or refreshments consumed by the student, the cost of
  5 17 clothing for the student, or the cost of disposable materials,
  5 18 including but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens,
  5 19 and art supplies.
  5 20    b.  For purposes of this section, "nonpublic school" means
  5 21 the same as defined in section 285.16.
  5 22    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose of
  5 23 obtaining an education voucher provided for in this section or
  5 24 who knowingly receives the voucher or makes a payment from an
  5 25 account in the education voucher fund without being legally
  5 26 entitled to it is guilty of a fraudulent practice. The false
  5 27 claim for an education voucher or a payment from an account
  5 28 shall be disallowed and if amounts from the voucher have
  5 29 been disbursed from the applicable account in the education
  5 30 voucher fund, the department of management shall initiate legal
  5 31 proceedings to recover such amounts. A parent or guardian who
  5 32 violates this subsection is prohibited from participating in
  5 33 the education voucher program in the future.
  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.
  6  9    Sec. 6.  Section 256F.3, subsection 2, paragraph a, Code
  6 10 2016, is amended to read as follows:
  6 11    a.    3 22 years.
  3 23    3.  The department of management shall assign each student an
  3 24 education voucher in an amount equal to seventy=five percent of
  3 25 the district of residence's regular program district cost per
  3 26 pupil in the same school year.
  3 27    4.  An education voucher fund is created in the state
  3 28 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 29 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department for
  3 30 the purpose of providing education vouchers under this
  3 31 section. For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2017, and
  3 32 each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the
  3 33 general fund of the state to the department of management to be
  3 34 credited to the fund the amount necessary to pay all education
  3 35 vouchers approved for that fiscal year. The director of the
  4  1 department of management has all powers necessary to carry out
  4  2 and effectuate the purposes, objectives, and provisions of this
  4  3 section pertaining to the fund, including the power to do all
  4  4 of the following:
  4  5    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  4  6 administration of the fund.
  4  7    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  4  8 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  4  9    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  4 10 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4 11 including providing for the disbursement of education vouchers
  4 12 in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that are
  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.
  4 16    e.  Adopt rules pursuant to chapter 17A for the

  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost
  5 16 of food or refreshments consumed by the student, the cost of
  5 17 clothing for the student, or the cost of disposable materials,
  5 18 including but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens,
  5 19 and art supplies.
  5 20    b.  For purposes of this section, "nonpublic school" means
  5 21 the same as defined in section 285.16.
  5 22    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose of
  5 23 obtaining an education voucher provided for in this section or
  5 24 who knowingly receives the voucher or makes a payment from an
  5 25 account in the education voucher fund without being legally
  5 26 entitled to it is guilty of a fraudulent practice. The false
  5 27 claim for an education voucher or a payment from an account
  5 28 shall be disallowed and if amounts from the voucher have
  5 29 been disbursed from the applicable account in the education
  5 30 voucher fund, the department of management shall initiate legal
  5 31 proceedings to recover such amounts. A parent or guardian who
  5 32 violates this subsection is prohibited from participating in
  5 33 the education voucher program in the future.
  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.
  6  9    Sec. 6.  Section 256F.3, subsection 2, paragraph a, Code
  6 10 2016, is amended to read as follows:
  6 11    a.    3 27    4.  An education voucher fund is created in the state
  3 28 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 29 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department for
  3 30 the purpose of providing education vouchers under this
  3 31 section. For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2017, and
  3 32 each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the
  3 33 general fund of the state to the department of management to be
  3 34 credited to the fund the amount necessary to pay all education
  3 35 vouchers approved for that fiscal year. The director of the
  4  1 department of management has all powers necessary to carry out
  4  2 and effectuate the purposes, objectives, and provisions of this
  4  3 section pertaining to the fund, including the power to do all
  4  4 of the following:
  4  5    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  4  6 administration of the fund.
  4  7    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  4  8 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  4  9    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  4 10 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4 11 including providing for the disbursement of education vouchers
  4 12 in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that are
  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.
  4 16    e.  Adopt rules pursuant to chapter 17A for the
  4 17 administration of the fund and accounts in the fund.
  4 18    5.  a.  For each student approved for an education voucher,
  4 19 the department shall establish an account for that student
  4 20 in the education voucher fund. The student's education
  4 21 voucher shall be deposited into the student's account on July
  4 22 1 and funds shall be immediately available for the payment
  4 23 of qualified educational expenses incurred by the parent or
  4 24 guardian for the student during that fiscal year using the
  4 25 payment method authorized under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 26    b.  A nonpublic school or other entity that accepts payment
  4 27 from a parent or guardian using funds from a student's account
  4 28 in the education voucher fund shall not refund, rebate, or
  4 29 share any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian,
  4 30 or student.
  4 31    c.  Moneys remaining in a student's account upon conclusion
  4 32 of the fiscal year shall remain in the student's account in the
  4 33 education voucher fund for the payment of qualified educational
  4 34 expenses in future fiscal years, unless subject to the transfer
  4 35 required under subsection 8.

  5  2 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,

  5  4 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  5  5 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific
  5  6 subject matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic
  5  7 online education programs, education materials and services
  5  8 for students with disabilities including the cost of
  5  9 paraprofessionals and assistants who are trained in accordance

  5 14 the department of education. "Qualified educational expenses"
  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost

  4 25 payment method authorized under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 26    b.  A nonpublic school or other entity that accepts payment
  4 27 from a parent or guardian using funds from a student's account
  4 28 in the education voucher fund shall not refund, rebate, or
  4 29 share any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian,
  4 30 or student.
  4 31    c.  Moneys remaining in a student's account upon conclusion
  4 32 of the fiscal year shall remain in the student's account in the
  4 33 education voucher fund for the payment of qualified educational
  4 34 expenses in future fiscal years, unless subject to the transfer
  4 35 required under subsection 8.
  5  1    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  5  2 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  5  3 textbooks, fees, or payments for educational therapies
  5  4 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  5  5 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific
  5  6 subject matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic
  5  7 online education programs, education materials and services
  5  8 for students with disabilities including the cost of
  5  9 paraprofessionals and assistants who are trained in accordance
  5 10 with state law, and other expenses incurred by the parent or
  5 11 guardian that are directly related to the education of the
  5 12 student at a nonpublic school, including a nonpublic school
  5 13 accredited by an independent accrediting agency approved by
  5 14 the department of education. "Qualified educational expenses"
  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost
  5 16 of food or refreshments consumed by the student, the cost of
  5 17 clothing for the student, or the cost of disposable materials,
  5 18 including but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens,
  5 19 and art supplies.
  5 20    b.  For purposes of this section, "nonpublic school" means
  5 21 the same as defined in section 285.16.
  5 22    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose of
  5 23 obtaining an education voucher provided for in this section or
  5 24 who knowingly receives the voucher or makes a payment from an
  5 25 account in the education voucher fund without being legally
  5 26 entitled to it is guilty of a fraudulent practice. The false
  5 27 claim for an education voucher or a payment from an account
  5 28 shall be disallowed and if amounts from the voucher have
  5 29 been disbursed from the applicable account in the education
  5 30 voucher fund, the department of management shall initiate legal
  5 31 proceedings to recover such amounts. A parent or guardian who
  5 32 violates this subsection is prohibited from participating in
  5 33 the education voucher program in the future.
  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.
  6  9    Sec. 6.  Section 256F.3, subsection 2, paragraph a, Code
  6 10 2016, is amended to read as follows:
  6 11    a.    3 33 general fund of the state to the department of management to be

  3 35 vouchers approved for that fiscal year. The director of the
  4  1 department of management has all powers necessary to carry out

  4  3 section pertaining to the fund, including the power to do all
  4  4 of the following:
  4  5    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  4  6 administration of the fund.
  4  7    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  4  8 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  4  9    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  4 10 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4 11 including providing for the disbursement of education vouchers
  4 12 in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that are
  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.

  5  2 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  5  3 textbooks, fees, or payments for educational therapies
  5  4 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  5  5 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific
  5  6 subject matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic
  5  7 online education programs, education materials and services
  5  8 for students with disabilities including the cost of
  5  9 paraprofessionals and assistants who are trained in accordance
  5 10 with state law, and other expenses incurred by the parent or
  5 11 guardian that are directly related to the education of the
  5 12 student at a nonpublic school, including a nonpublic school
  5 13 accredited by an independent accrediting agency approved by
  5 14 the department of education. "Qualified educational expenses"
  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost
  5 16 of food or refreshments consumed by the student, the cost of
  5 17 clothing for the student, or the cost of disposable materials,
  5 18 including but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens,
  5 19 and art supplies.
  5 20    b.  For purposes of this section, "nonpublic school" means
  5 21 the same as defined in section 285.16.
  5 22    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose of
  5 23 obtaining an education voucher provided for in this section or
  5 24 who knowingly receives the voucher or makes a payment from an
  5 25 account in the education voucher fund without being legally
  5 26 entitled to it is guilty of a fraudulent practice. The false
  5 27 claim for an education voucher or a payment from an account
  5 28 shall be disallowed and if amounts from the voucher have
  5 29 been disbursed from the applicable account in the education
  5 30 voucher fund, the department of management shall initiate legal
  5 31 proceedings to recover such amounts. A parent or guardian who
  5 32 violates this subsection is prohibited from participating in
  5 33 the education voucher program in the future.
  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.
  6  9    Sec. 6.  Section 256F.3, subsection 2, paragraph a, Code
  6 10 2016, is amended to read as follows:
  6 11    a.    4  4 of the following:
  4  5    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  4  6 administration of the fund.
  4  7    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  4  8 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  4  9    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  4 10 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4 11 including providing for the disbursement of education vouchers
  4 12 in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that are
  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.
  4 16    e.  Adopt rules pursuant to chapter 17A for the
  4 17 administration of the fund and accounts in the fund.
  4 18    5.  a.  For each student approved for an education voucher,
  4 19 the department shall establish an account for that student
  4 20 in the education voucher fund. The student's education
  4 21 voucher shall be deposited into the student's account on July
  4 22 1 and funds shall be immediately available for the payment
  4 23 of qualified educational expenses incurred by the parent or
  4 24 guardian for the student during that fiscal year using the
  4 25 payment method authorized under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 26    b.  A nonpublic school or other entity that accepts payment
  4 27 from a parent or guardian using funds from a student's account
  4 28 in the education voucher fund shall not refund, rebate, or
  4 29 share any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian,
  4 30 or student.
  4 31    c.  Moneys remaining in a student's account upon conclusion
  4 32 of the fiscal year shall remain in the student's account in the
  4 33 education voucher fund for the payment of qualified educational
  4 34 expenses in future fiscal years, unless subject to the transfer
  4 35 required under subsection 8.

  4 12 in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that are
  4 13 payable directly from the student's account in the fund.
  4 14    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4 15 administer the program.
  4 16    e.  Adopt rules pursuant to chapter 17A for the
  4 17 administration of the fund and accounts in the fund.
  4 18    5.  a.  For each student approved for an education voucher,
  4 19 the department shall establish an account for that student
  4 20 in the education voucher fund. The student's education
  4 21 voucher shall be deposited into the student's account on July
  4 22 1 and funds shall be immediately available for the payment
  4 23 of qualified educational expenses incurred by the parent or
  4 24 guardian for the student during that fiscal year using the
  4 25 payment method authorized under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 26    b.  A nonpublic school or other entity that accepts payment
  4 27 from a parent or guardian using funds from a student's account
  4 28 in the education voucher fund shall not refund, rebate, or
  4 29 share any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian,
  4 30 or student.
  4 31    c.  Moneys remaining in a student's account upon conclusion
  4 32 of the fiscal year shall remain in the student's account in the
  4 33 education voucher fund for the payment of qualified educational
  4 34 expenses in future fiscal years, unless subject to the transfer
  4 35 required under subsection 8.
  5  1    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  5  2 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  5  3 textbooks, fees, or payments for educational therapies
  5  4 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  5  5 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific
  5  6 subject matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic
  5  7 online education programs, education materials and services
  5  8 for students with disabilities including the cost of
  5  9 paraprofessionals and assistants who are trained in accordance
  5 10 with state law, and other expenses incurred by the parent or
  5 11 guardian that are directly related to the education of the
  5 12 student at a nonpublic school, including a nonpublic school
  5 13 accredited by an independent accrediting agency approved by
  5 14 the department of education. "Qualified educational expenses"
  5 15 does not include transportation costs for the student, the cost
  5 16 of food or refreshments consumed by the student, the cost of
  5 17 clothing for the student, or the cost of disposable materials,
  5 18 including but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens,
  5 19 and art supplies.
  5 20    b.  For purposes of this section, "nonpublic school" means
  5 21 the same as defined in section 285.16.
  5 22    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose of
  5 23 obtaining an education voucher provided for in this section or
  5 24 who knowingly receives the voucher or makes a payment from an
  5 25 account in the education voucher fund without being legally
  5 26 entitled to it is guilty of a fraudulent practice. The false
  5 27 claim for an education voucher or a payment from an account
  5 28 shall be disallowed and if amounts from the voucher have
  5 29 been disbursed from the applicable account in the education
  5 30 voucher fund, the department of management shall initiate legal
  5 31 proceedings to recover such amounts. A parent or guardian who
  5 32 violates this subsection is prohibited from participating in
  5 33 the education voucher program in the future.
  5 34    8.  For each student with a positive balance in the student's
  5 35 account in the education voucher fund upon graduation from
  6  1 high school or upon termination of the student's enrollment in
  6  2 the nonpublic school, moneys in the student's account shall be
  6  3 transferred by the department for deposit in the general fund
  6  4 of the state.
  6  5    9.  A nonpublic school that accepts payment from a parent or
  6  6 guardian using funds from a student's account in the education
  6  7 voucher fund is not an agent of this state or other political
  6  8 subdivision of this state.
